types.name: Nitroglycerin
types.description: The first practical explosive produced that was stronger than black powder.

types.name: Methyl nitrate
types.description: Methyl nitrate is a sensitive explosive. When ignited it burns extremely fiercely with a gray-blue flame.

types.name: Isopropyl Nitrate
types.description: Isopropyl nitrate is extremely flammable and burns with a practically invisible flame.

types.name: Gunpowder
types.description: It burns very quickly, and creates gases.

types.name: Flash powder
types.description: Fine metal powder (usually aluminium or magnesium) and a strong oxidizer.

types.name: Dynamite
types.description: An explosive made of nitroglycerin, sorbents (such as powdered shells or clay) and stabilizers.

types.name: TNT
types.description: One of the most commonly used explosives for military, industrial, and mining applications.
